channel.title: My friend botting mining...you won't believe this
channel.description:
Tell me if you think this is sad...
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/nfse1z.png[/img]
2,000 players in one spot, 1,500 mining one rock...Just something I thought I would share

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“wolfs goal, post:21, topic:357061”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=453576.msg3326539#msg3326539 date=1283142582]
I’m sure they have a warning system which tells them how long you’ve been logged on for, eg. a botter bots for 2 days, they think its suspisious they check you out and you wont respond so they ban you. There are other methods of getting banned, even in big crowds.
[/quote]

Theres an auto-log system that logs you out every 6 hours of activity. Basically this resets the counter. They usually go down there and say hi and hows everyone doing…then when the rock runs out, you see a lots of dots dissapear…Idk why though, maybe banned, maybe they logged…[/quote]You sure?

item.title: My friend botting mining...you won't believe this
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

Davidi2:

I use Rocktail to train cooking. Are there worlds for that too?

World 84 is a place were you go to do anything in living rock caverns. This is because of the large amount of players, so fishing rocktails or mining allows you to gain lots of xp an hour while not even getting attacked that much. This was made the unofficial LRC world when KMiner started supporting LRC and said use world 84 or you will die. After only 5 hours after the release, LRC already had 300+ Players. Then AutoMiner Pro(Same Script as KMiner just more Expensive) Started supporting LRC and they said use world 77 or you will die. Each bot is built for either world 77 or 84 depending on the combat. I think AutoMiner NX is world 88. I also contribute to Rune-Wikia for many things.

And, if your going to bot cooking. Do it in the rogues den in world 2 or in the members quick chat world. There will be other people botting and cooking legit. So you chances get less rare. Or, if your stealthy enough…you can bot at Soul Wars with a custom made script. Simply design a script that implements powerbot’s files. Then, create the bot by having the script withdraw 1 log, 1 tinderbox and 26 raw rocktail. Then, have the script tell the bot to use the log on the tinderbox and the raw rocktail on the fire. Then bank the burnt and cooked rocktail and withdraw a log and more rocktail. The “Anti-Ban” is simply the bot taking a different path from one place to another each time and having the bot not click in the same area AT ALL…

Hope this helped o.o

–Waiting for message to be approved by a moderator.

Read full topic

item.source: My friend botting mining...you won't believe this

item.title: My friend botting mining...you won't believe this
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

World 84 is the unofficial RuneScape Living Rock Caverns world. World 77 is also another available world as World 84 is usually full, however I have only used World 84.

Not everyone is a bot down there. There are many bots, but not everyone is down there for the mineral deposits, because it is the only location to fish Rocktail and Cavefish.

Coal deposits:

Concentrated coal rocks are located in the Living Rock Caverns. They require a Mining level of 77 to mine ore from them and give 50 experience per ore mined. There are 8 concentrated coal rocks in the game, which is double the number of concentrated gold rocks in the game. These rocks do not have gems! It's maybe advised to go from 65 - 77 with granite and mine coal to 80.

While mining, players can get either 1 or 2 coal ores at a time; when 2 ores are mined, players get the message: “You manage to mine two pieces of coal!” If a player is wearing any level of Varrock armour, they will even have the chance for their armour to mine an additional ore, resulting in up to 3 ores.

http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Concentrated_coal_rocks

Gold deposits:

Concentrated gold rocks can only be found in the Living Rock Caverns located north of the Dwarven Mine. They require a Mining level of 80 to mine ore from them and give 65 experience per ore mined. There are only 4 concentrated gold rocks in the game; they are in the northwest, northeast, southwest, and southeast corners of the cavern.

Concentrated gold rocks will give 1-3 gold ores at a time. If wearing Varrock armour, multiple ores will be mined even more frequently displaying the message “Your Varrock armour allows you to mine an additional ore”, and “you manage to mine two (or three) gold ores!” when mined on your own. Gems cannot be obtained from this type of rock.

Concentrated gold rocks are decent experience, at about 40-60k experience per hour, and can be a money making method for high level players because the rocks are very close to a deposit box. However the most notable feature for the avid use of this location is that this type of mining requires substantially less clicking than the constant attention necessary for normal mining

Note: This is a dangerous area as all of the monsters are above level 120 and are aggressive to players that come near them.

http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Concentrated_gold_rocks

Read full topic
